import Mathlib

open Set Metric

/-- If U âŠ‚ â„‚ is open and connected, f : U â†’ â„‚ is holomorphic (differentiable on U) and nonconstant,
and p âˆˆ U, then there exists Î´ > 0 such that the function f restricted to Î”_Î´(p) \ { p } is an open map. -/
theorem exists_delta_open_on_punctured_ball {U : Set â„‚} (hU : IsOpen U) (hUconn : IsConnected U)
  {f : â„‚ â†’ â„‚} (hd : DifferentiableOn â„‚ f U) (h_nonconst : âˆƒ x y, x âˆˆ U âˆ§ y âˆˆ U âˆ§ f x â‰  f y)
  (p : â„‚) (hp : p âˆˆ U) : âˆƒ Î´ > 0, IsOpenMap (fun z : {z : â„‚ // z âˆˆ ball p Î´ \ {p}} => f z.val) := by sorry
